LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.CoverageExplanation:
The coverage panel is a visualization of all the 'slots' on a pawn which can be covered by apparel. (currently in your game feels unnecessary)
Each box represents a body part (i.e. torso) and an apparel layer (i.e. onskin). Apparels can cover multiple body parts and span multiple layers. As such, layering clothing can be quite complex and conflict resolution can get complicated quickly.
Boxes are coloured to represent their current status: - Grey: There is no apparel in this loadout which covers this slot. - Red: There are multiple apparels which cover this slot. A semi-transparent apparel will be drawn, showing the highest priority apparel which would cover this slot, and hovering over the slot will show which apparel is blocking it. - Other: The remaining colours used in the visualization represents the tag an apparel is coming from and can be used to cross-reference corresponding layers with the primary tag.

LanguageData.CompositableLoadouts.StatesExplanation:
Loadout states are used for swapping between tags immediately after an action by a player, without modifying a pawns loadout. You are able to enable or disable certain tags in a pawns loadout depending on which state the pawn currently has active.
Right click a button in the below column to mass assign all pawns on the same Map/Caravan as the selected pawn to the same loadout state (this is useful for mass-assignment to states you may create such as 'War' when a raid is fired on a particular map).
